arrays.title: Introduction to Arrays
arrays.explanation: Arrays store elements in contiguous memory locations. They allow fast access via index.

stack.title: Understanding Stacks
stack.explanation: Stacks work on the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle. Common operations are push (append) and pop.

queue.title: Understanding Queues
queue.explanation: Queues follow First In First Out (FIFO) principle. Common operations are enqueue and dequeue.

linkedlist.title: Linked List Basics
linkedlist.explanation: A linked list consists of nodes where each node has data and a pointer to the next node.

sorting.title: Sorting Algorithms
sorting.explanation: Sorting arranges elements in a particular order. Examples include Bubble, Merge, and Quick sort.
